meanings.definition: The movement or orientation of an organism in response to gravity.
meanings.sent1: The fish displayed geotaxis by swimming towards the bottom of the tank.
meanings.sent2: Plants exhibit geotaxis by growing their roots downward into the soil.
meanings.sent3: The geotaxis of the squirrel caused it to constantly climb down trees in search of food.
meanings.sent4: The geotaxis of the seed was so strong that it pushed through the soil to reach the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The geotaxis of the bird was evident as it always perched on the highest branches of the tree.

meanings.definition: The directional response of an organism to the force of gravity.
meanings.sent1: The geotaxis of the insect led it to crawl downwards on the wall.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study geotaxis in animals to understand their natural behaviors.
meanings.sent3: The geotaxis of the cat made it prefer sleeping on the floor rather than on the bed.
meanings.sent4: The geotaxis of the rock caused it to roll downhill with the force of gravity.
meanings.sent5: The geotaxis of the balloon was evident as it always floated upwards towards the ceiling.
